result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy E Capitonoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to restitution, paid in full.
Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform agent of all prescriptions.
Attend a minimum of 2 Self Help meetings per week.

Cases 15CM502 and 15CF1029 were dismissed and read in. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. No Contact with the Target in New Berlin. Maintain employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Commencing forthwith. Any credit time to be submitted by defense attorney.
12/08/2015 COURT GRANTS REQUEST FROM DEFENSE ATTORNEY FOR 47 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Timothy E Capitonoff in court, in custody, with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1. Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.   State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Rosario makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS      **Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Target in New Berlin
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Attend minimum of 2 self help meetings per week 

RESTITUTION:  $149.99 to Target - New Berlin (to be paid out of cash bail posted-remainder to be returned to poster - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted-remainder to be returned to poster)

CONDITION TIME:  90 Days,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith (Defendant already in custody)  Credit time to be submitted by Attorney Rosario  

   Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

$1500.00 CASH ALREADY POSTED. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program. Defendant to report today after court to the WCS Office. This cash bail is in addition to the signature bond already signed.  DEFENDANT TO POST ADDITIONAL $1000.00
